item.title: Virus Cases in Europe Drop to Fewest Since March; India Sees Surge
item.description: Cases in Europe dropped to their lowest level since March 22, while India experienced its biggest single-day rise. The U.S.death toll rose to more than 106,000.

item.title: Hong Kong Residents Could Be Offered U.K. Citizenship Amid China Standoff
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson said Britain is considering providing a route to British citizenship for nearly three million Hong Kong residents, as the U.K. escalates a standoff with China.

item.title: Scientist Behind Sweden's No-Lockdown Policy Says It Wasn't Strict Enough
item.description: The epidemiologist behind Sweden’s controversial decision to forgo a mandatory lockdown conceded for the first time that more restrictions might have helped prevent a surge in coronavirus-related deaths.

item.title: The Pandemic Sent 1.5 Billion Children Home From School. Many Might Not Return.
item.description: School closures this spring are now compounding longstanding social differences, as hundreds of thousands of children in the U.S. and Europe who lacked the support to continue distance learning risk leaving school altogether.

item.title: Stung by Past Mistakes, Eurozone Takes a Page From U.S. to Fight Crisis
item.description: Worried about the depth of its economic downturn, Europe is lining up two new packages potentially worth hundreds of billions of euros that boost prospects for a global recovery.

item.title: With Hong Kong's Tiananmen Square Vigil Canceled, 'The Fire Is Flickering'
item.description: Hong Kong vigil goers fear they may never again be allowed to congregate for the annual June 4 event, long seen as a symbol of the city’s autonomy from Beijing, that honors the students killed in Tiananmen Square in 1989.

item.title: A Record-Breaking Economic Boom Is About to Go Bust
item.description: Australia’s 28-year growth streak survived a regional economic crisis in the 1990s, a global economic crisis in the 2000s, and a boom-bust cycle in its core commodity sector in the 2010s. Now, a recession looms after the economy contracted in the first three months of the year.
